headline: CORN SLIPS, WHEAT RALLIES AT COMMODITY CLASSIC
subheadline: Front-month corn drops over 1% while Chicago wheat posts a 2.5% gain heading into the weekend.
lead: Corn futures gave back ground Friday, with the front month settling at 438.75, down 1.13%. Chicago wheat stole the show, jumping 2.51% to 591.25. Soybeans slid 0.71% to 1157.25 as soybean meal took a 2% hit. The trade heads into the weekend digesting news from Commodity Classic 2026 in the heart of corn country.
teaser: Wheat rallies, corn stumbles, and Commodity Classic buzzes—here's what farmers need to know.

one_number.context: Wheat's Friday rally stands out in a session where corn and beans both finished red.

sections.title: GRAINS & OILSEEDS
sections.body: Front-month corn settled at 438.75, off 1.13%, while December 2026 corn held firmer at 469.5, up 0.43%. Chicago wheat surged 2.51% to 591.25—the standout gainer in the grains complex. Soybeans slipped to 1157.25, weighed down by a 2.05% drop in soybean meal to 315.5.

sections.title: WEATHER & FIELD CONDITIONS
sections.body: Central Illinois is dry and cool—42°F under overcast skies with only a 2% chance of precipitation. The 3-day precip total sits at zero, meaning soils remain firm. Highs near 50°F and lows in the mid-20s mean no field work yet, but conditions are stable heading into March.

sections.title: MARKETS & MACRO
sections.body: Live cattle jumped nearly 3% to 244.0, a strong close for the beef complex. Crude oil rallied 2.62% to 67.02, which could lift input costs if sustained. The dollar index was flat at 97.565, offering no major headwind or tailwind for exports. Treasury yields eased slightly.

watch_list.desc: Weekend position squaring—watch for Monday open tone after Commodity Classic headlines digest.
USDA weekly export inspections and any weather shifts as March begins.
Soybean meal weakness dragging the crush complex lower and pressuring bean prices.
Wheat momentum—if Chicago wheat holds above 590, bulls may push for a test of 600.
